item.title: Find broken hyperlinks in a PDF document with PDFx
item.description: PDFx is a free command-line tool to extract references, links and metadata from PDF files. You can also use it to find broken links in a PDF file, using pdfx -c: For each URL and PDF reference, pdfx performs a HEAD request and checks the status code. It there are broken links, PDFx print the link with the page number where the link was found in the original pdf: $ pdfx https://weakdh.

item.title: PDFx v1.0 - Extract metadata and URLs from PDFs, and download all referenced PDFs
item.description: I just released PDFx version 1.0, a Python tool and library to extract metadata and URLs from PDFs, and to automatically download all referenced PDFs. The project is released under the Apache license with the source code on Github!
